result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederick A. Polsfuss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Frederick A. Polsfuss is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Frederick A. Polsfuss was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Frederick A. Polsfuss was found guilty of Reckless Driving-Endanger Safety. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Restrictions on travel: Shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Frederick A. Polsfuss in court, in custody.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant sent request for SPD; have not made it over to meet yet. Discussion held. Court calls SPD to notify that they need to meet with defendant. Def requests reduction on bail. State objects, proper notice not given. Court gives petition for appointment of counsel; will recall case. 
Case recalled. Appearances same. Discussion held regarding petition. Defendant not eligible for SPD; was not eligible in prior case. Court heard and appoints Atty Todd Snow at rate of $75/month comm 10/15/14. Jail shall provide one call to Atty. Upon withdrawal of Atty Green on CM and CT case, court will appoint Atty Snow on those cases as well.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Restrictions on travel: Shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

10:33 - Defendant, Frederick A. Polsfuss in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $5,000 Cash bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.
to Def. w/correct court date
